comments: According to one student, “anyone interested in medicine and its history would truly benefit from taking this course.” Overall, students commented on how great they thought the field trips were, the interesting discussions they had, and the value they found in the thesis paper they wrote.  Although some students thought that there could have been more discussion, that there was too much reading, and that the course was at times not cohesive, the general consensus was that the class was beneficial and very interesting.
